reviewText:
Well, I'm a bit on the fence on this one. I'll lean slightly towards recommending it. I have played many point and click games in my life and feel like I'm pretty good at figuring out some of the more interesting clues, but with Deponia I found some of them rather confusing. I ended up looking through a walkthrough more with this game that any other I've played.

Sure, it has humour and an amusing story, but it was more annoying that anything. While I'd be interested to find out where the story goes with the other three, I'm kinda glad I didn't buy them all at once.

While the voice acting was good, the sound was often a little all over the place. Sometimes the voices were loud, other times they seemed almost background. There were bugs in some levels and the puzzles were not always intuative.

And writing this review has actually pushed me back over the line, so I am not recommending this game.

reviewText:
[Edit: The standalone game has now been patched as well. This means I can recommend the game, with the caveat of checking current special offers (vs The Complete Journey). Leaving the original review below since the bait-and-switch still DID occur.]

Good game BUT a word of warning:

Deponia and it's sequels are since september 2014 presumably abandonware. Instead of patching the remaining bugs of the separate games the developer/publisher Daedalic decided to release an all-in-one title called Deponia: The Complete Journey. It's a completely new separate title, not a 'pack' containing the previous games, so there is no way to upgrade from the standalone titles. It also does not create giftable versions of the titles you already own.

If you are new to the game and want to buy and play Deponia (which is a terrific and fun Point-and-Click) get The Complete Journey.

Personally I think this move is blatantly unfriendly to early adopters and existing customers and would probably not buy anything from Daedalic again, let alone this new all-in-one version.

reviewText:
This particular game has caught me in between liking it and disliking it.

Let me go through the things I liked about this game, I enjoyed the humor it contained. It's something fresh to me since I've hardly play games which contain much humor in it as this one does have. The artwork through the game also was appealing to me since I am a fan of good ingame art and graphics.

What I disliked about it was how some of the puzzles were a bit funky and you pretty much had to think outside the box just to solve it. The main character annoyed the fricks out of me. His personality during the first part of the game was fine at first, it was easy to handle. But as the game progresses you either grow to hate it or become immune to it. I personally started to get annoyed with his dialogue and ended up skipping parts because of it.

Overall, I'd say if you have the biggest patience with puzzle games especially weird once then this is the game for you. I wish there was an in between recommendation in steam for this.

reviewText: (TL;DR: Don't buy it for more than 2€.) I'm an optimistic man that wants to like a game even if it has great weaknesses. I bought this one when it was like -90% on Steam holiday sale. The graphics and voices are excellent, also the music is great. But that's about it. I did want to finish it after I had been playing it for a while, but then after a while I was already waiting for the game to end as quickly as possible (sadly it didn't). I would never play it again and for the most part it is a waste of time. I am however still eager enough to quickly google the plot lines of the other 2 parts, so I guess the plot isn't that horrible. But I also would never buy it again, 2€ was the biggest price for the enjoyment that I got out of it, no disrespect. Every review I've read about it also agrees with me on this: the game isn't funny. It must've been only 1 or 2 times that I laughed during the whole game, and even then I wasn't rolling on the floor unable to breathe. I'm sorry to inform you, this one isn't worth your time or money.

reviewText:
Deponia is a adventure game of the type I like the most. Challenging puzzles, cartoony 2D-graphics, no action elemements and a good humorous story.

The best aspect of the game is probably the creative andsometimes quite challenging puzzles. In some adventure games the solution to a puzzle is almost immediately obvious because there are so few possible things to try. In Deponia trial and error is not a quick and easy approach, since there are many objects and lots of things to interact with. In particular in the first part of the game the puzzles require a bit of out of the box thinking without being unfair. Puzzles are also fairly varied and always feel like a natural part of the game rather than tacked on. My only complaint in this department is that the very end of the game is a bit anticlimactic in terms of puzzle difficulty.

The story is humorous and entertaining with unique character. The humour doesn't always work, but there are moments of brilliance, and it worked often enough to keep me entertained throughout. The ending is a bit disappointing but it does leave things at an appropriate starting point for the sequel.

The cartoony graphics are entirely appropriate given the general tone of the game and are high quality and quite distinctive. Characters each have their own unique appearance and do not look generic at all like they do in too many games.

Voice acting is above average but not exceeptional. The music has a unique style that is very appropriate given the particular setting and is quite appealing too.

All in all this is a highly recommended adventure game if you like pure point and click adventures with challenging puzzles and a healthy dose of humour.

reviewText: Review time for Deponia.\nStory- Deponia is a world of trash... literally. The people live in trash on top of mountains of trash making a living from trash. But for a brash, lazy, young Rufus, he wanted more. So in his latest hair-brained scheme to escape to Elesium, he saves a a damsel in distress from a militant group and finds himself mixed in a conspiracy that will affect everyone on Deponia. The story is a good bit of comedy in the vein of Lucas Arts The Curse of Monkey Island" with memorable characters and involving plot twists. The world in the story is also very imaginative and filled with a lot of potetial for exploration. A+\nGraphics- Those who are familiar with "The Curse of Monkey Island" may see a lot of similarities in art style. It does show that many of the developers and artist were fans of Lucas Arts. But dispite similarities
date: this game is a whole new beast and completely original in character design and world creation and is every well done. The cutscenes are also very well done and is like looking at a cartoon television show. A\nSound- The voice acting in this game is spot on in terms of delivery
recommended: though the lip-sync can be terribly off which was a little bit destracting
hoursPlayed: but not unforgivable. As for the music... I LOVE THE MUSIC! There is a very good mix of ballads
voteText: a touch of hip-hop and just fun altogether. A+\nGameplay- Simple

votesTotal: great characters and music that should not be missed. Highly recomended. A"

A point and click adventure game. If you don't know what that is, go check some flash games. The rest can continue to read -
Rather interesting story, which is the mayor goal for adventure games like these. A strong character as well. As I read other reviews, many people disliked Rufus for being arrogant and an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. reviewText:
What drew me to this game was its amazing art style. In fact, many of the scenes from the game have become my rotating Desktop Wallpapers. This game is a joy to play, with plently of interesting chaarcters to meet. Rufus, though he is a assholish neanderthal, he still kept endearing himself, especiall his little tantrum near the end of the game.

The puzzles are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t though. I am no ashamed that I looked at a guide, because ♥♥♥♥ the game without it. Still I figured out many of them out by myself, so with patince you can solve them.

reviewText: Fun game, is what can be said. The world is an interesting mix of Douglas Adams and Terry Pratchett styles, and the story, maybe not the most unique ever, is capturing and fun. The graphics are reminiscent of The Curse of Monkey Island. You know, those hand painted backgrounds! The main character, Rufus, is a fun guy but can be seen at times as obnoxious and unlikable, but he does make up for it in the end. The ending, which I do not wish to spoil, was incredible and not predictable. Some of the jokes feel forced at times and the puzzles may seem tedious (but there's a skip button for those more frustrated gamers). Get it, and play it. It's well worth it, and experience the wonder that is Deponia!

The music is great.  The only thing is that the game can have some weird responsiveness from time to time and it's not always as smooth as you'd like.  I have the second one, but haven't played it yet.  I plan on buying the third.  Great story... a fun play, for sure.

reviewText: I normally don't prefer point & click adventure games, But Deponia is the exception with me. a game that is crafted excellently, from the characters to fun and hilarious story, with puzzles that really are difficult too. but I must say, don't think logically when playing this game. the puzzles are solved in a comedic sort of way, which makes it a fun and entertaining game that's well worth it! if you like a good off the wall challenge that is. :)

reviewText: It's one of those adventure games where sometimes the solutions are so ridiculous that it makes you want to throw something. Honestly there is alot of charm to the game. The atmosphere and environments are actually quite nice. The animation quality is great, but I am sorry to say that I would have to give this one a pass. I played a couple hours in, and hey maybe it gets better. I really wanted to love this game, but seriously, the solutions are so ridiculous. My best way to describe it would be the whole duck and rope solution in the train station from the game The Longest Journey"
date: except that almost every one you do will feel like that."

reviewText:
I absolutely loved Deponia! It made me so happy to finally play a point click action adventure game again after what feels like ages! Seriously, when was the last time I played an actual great point click adventure game? King's quest 7? Leisure Suit Larry love for sale? I dunno, it's certainly been a while though.

This game is brilliant, 2d point click adventure animation at it's finest! I love the characters, the rude somewhat selfish Rufus as the main character who is a real &^% hole (But has a certain reason behind his actions later in the series), Goal the beautiful inteliigent girl of your dreams who is just out of reach, Toni the hot ex girlfriend you secretly wish you were still with and a wacky assortment of city residents who all seem to think your a loser and need to just vanish off the face of the planet.
Your mission is to find a way off deponia and reach a utopia of sorts known as Elysium, where it is known to be a clean beautiful land full of happiness and what not...unlike Deponia in which you start from, litterally a landfill of a world composed of junk on top of junk for miles to see. There are tons of animations way more than any point click adventure I have ever seen and I actually ponder quite a bit as to how long it took the developers to create these games. Either they had a large team or this took quite some time.

This game is so impressive, I really hope more people give it a try and keep it alive for years to come.
